column1: Stools that are pale, clay, or putty-colored may be due to problems in the biliary system (the drainage system of the gallbladder, liver, and pancreas).
The liver releases bile salts into the stool, giving it a normal brown color.

Possible causes for clay-colored stools include: - Alcoholic hepatitis - Biliary cirrhosis - Cancer or noncancerous (benign) tumors of the liver, biliary system, or pancreas - Cysts of the bile ducts - Gallstones - Medications - Narrowings (strictures) of the bile ducts - Sclerosing cholangitis - Structural problems in the biliary system that are present from birth (congenital) - Viral hepatitis There may be other causes not listed here.
The doctor will perform a physical exam and ask questions about your medical history and symptoms.
